entry.title: Large language models explained
entry.summary: River bank or bank account? How chatbots learned to make the quantum leap to context by training on billions of prompts - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: The commitment to collaborate
entry.summary: Though natural selection favours self-interest, humans are extraordinarily good at cooperating with one another. Why? - by Saira Khan Read at Aeon

entry.title: Children’s game: chivichanas
entry.summary: In this immersive portrait of play, children transform the streets of Havana into a racetrack with handmade ‘chivichanas’ - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: Did you think you were safe?
entry.summary: When I moved to India for work, I found that rape was a feature of the country, as deeply embedded as caste - by Evelyn Fok Read at Aeon

entry.title: Prayer is the greatest freedom of all
entry.summary: ‘I think that freedom everywhere, anywhere is love.’ Father Giles, a monk for 47 years, shares his radical view of freedom - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: The bookends of time
entry.summary: Nothing lasts forever: not humanity, not Earth, not the Universe. But finitude confers an indelible meaning to our lives - by Thomas Moynihan Read at Aeon

entry.title: Beyond causality
entry.summary: In order to bridge the yawning gulf between the humanities and the sciences we must turn to an unexpected field: mathematics - by Gordon Gillespie Read at Aeon

entry.title: Slow-motion tongues
entry.summary: Striking slow-motion footage captures the awesome evolutionary diversity – and handy usefulness – of a lizard’s tongue - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: How the Moon became a place
entry.summary: For most of history, the Moon was regarded as a mysterious and powerful object. Then scientists made it into a destination - by Danny Robb Read at Aeon

entry.title: A former slave’s letter to his old master
entry.summary: ‘Will you send us our wages for the time that we served you?’ A freed slave answers his old master’s request to come back - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: So many unmarried men
entry.summary: For Mary Midgley, the Western philosophical tradition is shaped by the fact that its greatest practitioners were bachelors - by Ellie Robson Read at Aeon

entry.title: The cheekiest potter
entry.summary: A ceramicist puts a playful twist on Italian Renaissance pottery with dirty jokes, emojis and colourful commentary on menopause - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: Poverty is not permanent
entry.summary: By understanding the pernicious myths surrounding poverty, we can make progress towards a lofty goal: dignity for all - by Anirudh Krishna & Dirk Philipsen Read at Aeon

entry.title: Guardians of the gibbons
entry.summary: Humans are both the gravest threat and the greatest hope for the survival of the rare hoolock gibbons in northeast India - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: A very American fear
entry.summary: Moral panics about erotica have coursed through the country’s history. Why do so many Americans think of porn as harm? - by Rebecca L Davis Read at Aeon

entry.title: How to see an exquisite corpse
entry.summary: A history of the ‘exquisite corpse’ in art shows how it embodies surrealist ideas of freedom, community and radical creativity - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: The birth of naturalism
entry.summary: The modern era is often seen as the triumph of science over supernaturalism. But what really happened is far more interesting - by Peter Harrison Read at Aeon

entry.title: Mother tongue
entry.summary: In animations that evoke the fog of memory, Susan returns to her childhood in Korea, speaking a language she no longer knows - by Aeon Video Watch at Aeon

entry.title: Passion and Palestine
entry.summary: More than any other conflict, Israel/Palestine has provoked extraordinarily fervent emotion throughout the world. Why? - by Derek Jonathan Penslar Read at Aeon

entry.title: Hearts and brains
entry.summary: Humans always end up with clogged arteries, right? That’s not what the lives of the Tsimane in the Amazon basin tell us - by Ben Daitz Read at Aeon
